00058 /* ********************** Threaded Jobs Manager ****************************** */
00059 
00060 /*
00061  * Add new job
00062  * - register in WM
00063  * - configure callbacks
00064  *
00065  * Start or re-run job
00066  * - if job running
00067  *   - signal job to end
00068  *   - add timer notifier to verify when it has ended, to start it
00069  * - else
00070  *   - start job
00071  *   - add timer notifier to handle progress
00072  *
00073  * Stop job
00074  *   - signal job to end
00075  *  on end, job will tag itself as sleeping
00076  *
00077  * Remove job
00078  * - signal job to end
00079  *  on end, job will remove itself
00080  *
00081  * When job is done:
00082  * - it puts timer to sleep (or removes?)
00083  *
00084  */
00085  
00086 struct wmJob {
00087     struct wmJob *next, *prev;
00088     
00089     /* job originating from, keep track of this when deleting windows */
00090     wmWindow *win;
00091     
00092     /* should store entire own context, for start, update, free */
00093     void *customdata;
00094     /* to prevent cpu overhead, use this one which only gets called when job really starts, not in thread */
00095     void (*initjob)(void *);
00096     /* this runs inside thread, and does full job */
00097     void (*startjob)(void *, short *stop, short *do_update, float *progress);
00098     /* update gets called if thread defines so, and max once per timerstep */
00099     /* it runs outside thread, blocking blender, no drawing! */
00100     void (*update)(void *);
00101     /* free entire customdata, doesn't run in thread */
00102     void (*free)(void *);
00103     /* gets called when job is stopped, not in thread */
00104     void (*endjob)(void *);
00105     
00106     /* running jobs each have own timer */
00107     double timestep;
00108     wmTimer *wt;
00109     /* the notifier event timers should send */
00110     unsigned int note, endnote;
00111     
00112     
00113 /* internal */
00114     void *owner;
00115     int flag;
00116     short suspended, running, ready, do_update, stop;
00117     float progress;
00118 
00119     /* for display in header, identification */
00120     char name[128];
00121     
00122     /* once running, we store this separately */
00123     void *run_customdata;
00124     void (*run_free)(void *);
00125     
00126     /* we use BLI_threads api, but per job only 1 thread runs */
00127     ListBase threads;
00128 
00129 };
00130 
00131 /* finds:
00132  * 1st priority: job with same owner and name
00133  * 2nd priority: job with same owner
00134  */
00135 static wmJob *wm_job_find(wmWindowManager *wm, void *owner, const char *name)
00136 {
00137     wmJob *steve, *found = NULL;
00138     
00139     for (steve = wm->jobs.first; steve; steve = steve->next)
00140         if (steve->owner == owner) {
00141             found = steve;
00142             if (name && strcmp(steve->name, name) == 0)
00143                 return steve;
00144         }
00145     
00146     return found;
00147 }
00148 
00149 /* ******************* public API ***************** */
00150 
00151 /* returns current or adds new job, but doesnt run it */
00152 /* every owner only gets a single job, adding a new one will stop running stop and 
00153  * when stopped it starts the new one */
00154 wmJob *WM_jobs_get(wmWindowManager *wm, wmWindow *win, void *owner, const char *name, int flag)
00155 {
00156     wmJob *steve = wm_job_find(wm, owner, name);
00157     
00158     if (steve == NULL) {
00159         steve = MEM_callocN(sizeof(wmJob), "new job");
00160     
00161         BLI_addtail(&wm->jobs, steve);
00162         steve->win = win;
00163         steve->owner = owner;
00164         steve->flag = flag;
00165         BLI_strncpy(steve->name, name, sizeof(steve->name));
00166     }
00167     
00168     return steve;
00169 }
00170 
00171 /* returns true if job runs, for UI (progress) indicators */
00172 int WM_jobs_test(wmWindowManager *wm, void *owner)
00173 {
00174     wmJob *steve;
00175     
00176     /* job can be running or about to run (suspended) */
00177     for (steve = wm->jobs.first; steve; steve = steve->next)
00178         if (steve->owner == owner)
00179             if (steve->running || steve->suspended)
00180                 return 1;
00181 
00182     return 0;
00183 }
00184 
00185 float WM_jobs_progress(wmWindowManager *wm, void *owner)
00186 {
00187     wmJob *steve = wm_job_find(wm, owner, NULL);
00188     
00189     if (steve && steve->flag & WM_JOB_PROGRESS)
00190         return steve->progress;
00191     
00192     return 0.0;
00193 }
00194 
00195 char *WM_jobs_name(wmWindowManager *wm, void *owner)
00196 {
00197     wmJob *steve = wm_job_find(wm, owner, NULL);
00198     
00199     if (steve)
00200         return steve->name;
00201     
00202     return NULL;
00203 }
00204 
00205 int WM_jobs_is_running(wmJob *steve)
00206 {
00207     return steve->running;
00208 }
00209 
00210 void *WM_jobs_get_customdata(wmJob *steve)
00211 {
00212     if (!steve->customdata) {
00213         return steve->run_customdata;
00214     }
00215     else {
00216         return steve->customdata;
00217     }
00218 }
00219 
00220 void WM_jobs_customdata(wmJob *steve, void *customdata, void (*free)(void *))
00221 {
00222     /* pending job? just free */
00223     if (steve->customdata)
00224         steve->free(steve->customdata);
00225     
00226     steve->customdata = customdata;
00227     steve->free = free;
00228 
00229     if (steve->running) {
00230         /* signal job to end */
00231         steve->stop = 1;
00232     }
00233 }
00234 
00235 void WM_jobs_timer(wmJob *steve, double timestep, unsigned int note, unsigned int endnote)
00236 {
00237     steve->timestep = timestep;
00238     steve->note = note;
00239     steve->endnote = endnote;
00240 }
00241 
00242 void WM_jobs_callbacks(wmJob *steve, 
00243                        void (*startjob)(void *, short *, short *, float *),
00244                        void (*initjob)(void *),
00245                        void (*update)(void *),
00246                        void (*endjob)(void *))
00247 {
00248     steve->startjob = startjob;
00249     steve->initjob = initjob;
00250     steve->update = update;
00251     steve->endjob = endjob;
00252 }
00253 
00254 static void *do_job_thread(void *job_v)
00255 {
00256     wmJob *steve = job_v;
00257     
00258     steve->startjob(steve->run_customdata, &steve->stop, &steve->do_update, &steve->progress);
00259     steve->ready = 1;
00260     
00261     return NULL;
00262 }
00263 
00264 /* don't allow same startjob to be executed twice */
00265 static void wm_jobs_test_suspend_stop(wmWindowManager *wm, wmJob *test)
00266 {
00267     wmJob *steve;
00268     int suspend = 0;
00269     
00270     /* job added with suspend flag, we wait 1 timer step before activating it */
00271     if (test->flag & WM_JOB_SUSPEND) {
00272         suspend = 1;
00273         test->flag &= ~WM_JOB_SUSPEND;
00274     }
00275     else {
00276         /* check other jobs */
00277         for (steve = wm->jobs.first; steve; steve = steve->next) {
00278             /* obvious case, no test needed */
00279             if (steve == test || !steve->running) continue;
00280             
00281             /* if new job is not render, then check for same startjob */
00282             if (0 == (test->flag & WM_JOB_EXCL_RENDER))
00283                 if (steve->startjob != test->startjob)
00284                     continue;
00285             
00286             /* if new job is render, any render job should be stopped */
00287             if (test->flag & WM_JOB_EXCL_RENDER)
00288                 if (0 == (steve->flag & WM_JOB_EXCL_RENDER))
00289                     continue;
00290 
00291             suspend = 1;
00292 
00293             /* if this job has higher priority, stop others */
00294             if (test->flag & WM_JOB_PRIORITY) {
00295                 steve->stop = 1;
00296                 // printf("job stopped: %s\n", steve->name);
00297             }
00298         }
00299     }
00300     
00301     /* possible suspend ourselfs, waiting for other jobs, or de-suspend */
00302     test->suspended = suspend;
00303     // if (suspend) printf("job suspended: %s\n", test->name);
00304 }
00305 
00306 /* if job running, the same owner gave it a new job */
00307 /* if different owner starts existing startjob, it suspends itself */
00308 void WM_jobs_start(wmWindowManager *wm, wmJob *steve)
00309 {
00310     if (steve->running) {
00311         /* signal job to end and restart */
00312         steve->stop = 1;
00313         // printf("job started a running job, ending... %s\n", steve->name);
00314     }
00315     else {
00316         
00317         if (steve->customdata && steve->startjob) {
00318             
00319             wm_jobs_test_suspend_stop(wm, steve);
00320             
00321             if (steve->suspended == 0) {
00322                 /* copy to ensure proper free in end */
00323                 steve->run_customdata = steve->customdata;
00324                 steve->run_free = steve->free;
00325                 steve->free = NULL;
00326                 steve->customdata = NULL;
00327                 steve->running = 1;
00328                 
00329                 if (steve->initjob)
00330                     steve->initjob(steve->run_customdata);
00331                 
00332                 steve->stop = 0;
00333                 steve->ready = 0;
00334                 steve->progress = 0.0;
00335 
00336                 // printf("job started: %s\n", steve->name);
00337                 
00338                 BLI_init_threads(&steve->threads, do_job_thread, 1);
00339                 BLI_insert_thread(&steve->threads, steve);
00340             }
00341             
00342             /* restarted job has timer already */
00343             if (steve->wt == NULL)
00344                 steve->wt = WM_event_add_timer(wm, steve->win, TIMERJOBS, steve->timestep);
00345         }
00346         else printf("job fails, not initialized\n");
00347     }
00348 }
00349 
00350 /* stop job, free data completely */
00351 static void wm_jobs_kill_job(wmWindowManager *wm, wmJob *steve)
00352 {
00353     if (steve->running) {
00354         /* signal job to end */
00355         steve->stop = 1;
00356         BLI_end_threads(&steve->threads);
00357 
00358         if (steve->endjob)
00359             steve->endjob(steve->run_customdata);
00360     }
00361     
00362     if (steve->wt)
00363         WM_event_remove_timer(wm, steve->win, steve->wt);
00364     if (steve->customdata)
00365         steve->free(steve->customdata);
00366     if (steve->run_customdata)
00367         steve->run_free(steve->run_customdata);
00368     
00369     /* remove steve */
00370     BLI_remlink(&wm->jobs, steve);
00371     MEM_freeN(steve);
00372     
00373 }
00374 
00375 void WM_jobs_stop_all(wmWindowManager *wm)
00376 {
00377     wmJob *steve;
00378     
00379     while ((steve = wm->jobs.first))
00380         wm_jobs_kill_job(wm, steve);
00381     
00382 }
00383 
00384 /* signal job(s) from this owner or callback to stop, timer is required to get handled */
00385 void WM_jobs_stop(wmWindowManager *wm, void *owner, void *startjob)
00386 {
00387     wmJob *steve;
00388     
00389     for (steve = wm->jobs.first; steve; steve = steve->next)
00390         if (steve->owner == owner || steve->startjob == startjob)
00391             if (steve->running)
00392                 steve->stop = 1;
00393 }
00394 
00395 /* actually terminate thread and job timer */
00396 void WM_jobs_kill(wmWindowManager *wm, void *owner, void (*startjob)(void *, short int *, short int *, float *))
00397 {
00398     wmJob *steve;
00399     
00400     steve = wm->jobs.first;
00401     while (steve) {
00402         if (steve->owner == owner || steve->startjob == startjob) {
00403             wmJob *bill = steve;
00404             steve = steve->next;
00405             wm_jobs_kill_job(wm, bill);
00406         }
00407         else {
00408             steve = steve->next;
00409         }
00410     }
00411 }
00412 
00413 
00414 /* kill job entirely, also removes timer itself */
00415 void wm_jobs_timer_ended(wmWindowManager *wm, wmTimer *wt)
00416 {
00417     wmJob *steve;
00418     
00419     for (steve = wm->jobs.first; steve; steve = steve->next) {
00420         if (steve->wt == wt) {
00421             wm_jobs_kill_job(wm, steve);
00422             return;
00423         }
00424     }
00425 }
00426 
00427 /* hardcoded to event TIMERJOBS */
00428 void wm_jobs_timer(const bContext *C, wmWindowManager *wm, wmTimer *wt)
00429 {
00430     wmJob *steve = wm->jobs.first, *stevenext;
00431     float total_progress = 0.f;
00432     float jobs_progress = 0;
00433     
00434     
00435     for (; steve; steve = stevenext) {
00436         stevenext = steve->next;
00437         
00438         if (steve->wt == wt) {
00439             
00440             /* running threads */
00441             if (steve->threads.first) {
00442                 
00443                 /* always call note and update when ready */
00444                 if (steve->do_update || steve->ready) {
00445                     if (steve->update)
00446                         steve->update(steve->run_customdata);
00447                     if (steve->note)
00448                         WM_event_add_notifier(C, steve->note, NULL);
00449 
00450                     if (steve->flag & WM_JOB_PROGRESS)
00451                         WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_WM | ND_JOB, NULL);
00452                     steve->do_update = 0;
00453                 }   
00454                 
00455                 if (steve->ready) {
00456                     if (steve->endjob)
00457                         steve->endjob(steve->run_customdata);
00458 
00459                     /* free own data */
00460                     steve->run_free(steve->run_customdata);
00461                     steve->run_customdata = NULL;
00462                     steve->run_free = NULL;
00463                     
00464                     // if (steve->stop) printf("job ready but stopped %s\n", steve->name);
00465                     // else printf("job finished %s\n", steve->name);
00466 
00467                     steve->running = 0;
00468                     BLI_end_threads(&steve->threads);
00469                     
00470                     if (steve->endnote)
00471                         WM_event_add_notifier(C, steve->endnote, NULL);
00472                     
00473                     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_WM | ND_JOB, NULL);
00474                     
00475                     /* new job added for steve? */
00476                     if (steve->customdata) {
00477                         // printf("job restarted with new data %s\n", steve->name);
00478                         WM_jobs_start(wm, steve);
00479                     }
00480                     else {
00481                         WM_event_remove_timer(wm, steve->win, steve->wt);
00482                         steve->wt = NULL;
00483                         
00484                         /* remove steve */
00485                         BLI_remlink(&wm->jobs, steve);
00486                         MEM_freeN(steve);
00487                     }
00488                 }
00489                 else if (steve->flag & WM_JOB_PROGRESS) {
00490                     /* accumulate global progress for running jobs */
00491                     jobs_progress++;
00492                     total_progress += steve->progress;
00493                 }
00494             }
00495             else if (steve->suspended) {
00496                 WM_jobs_start(wm, steve);
00497             }
00498         }
00499         else if (steve->threads.first && !steve->ready) {
00500             if (steve->flag & WM_JOB_PROGRESS) {
00501                 /* accumulate global progress for running jobs */
00502                 jobs_progress++;
00503                 total_progress += steve->progress;
00504             }
00505         }
00506     }
00507     
00508     /* on file load 'winactive' can be NULL, possibly it should not happen but for now do a NULL check - campbell */
00509     if (wm->winactive) {
00510         /* if there are running jobs, set the global progress indicator */
00511         if (jobs_progress > 0) {
00512             float progress = total_progress / (float)jobs_progress;
00513             WM_progress_set(wm->winactive, progress);
00514         }
00515         else {
00516             WM_progress_clear(wm->winactive);
00517         }
00518     }
00519 }
00520 
00521 int WM_jobs_has_running(wmWindowManager *wm)
00522 {
00523     wmJob *steve;
00524 
00525     for (steve = wm->jobs.first; steve; steve = steve->next)
00526         if (steve->running)
00527             return 1;
00528 
00529     return 0;
00530 }
